summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The DVD_AudioAttributes structure is used in to receive the various audio attributes of the disc.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.AppMode
member.summary: Indicates the current audio mode. If the mode returned is DVD_AudioMode_Karaoke, call to get more info.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.AudioFormat
member.summary: Describes the format (encoding mode) of the audio stream.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.Language
member.summary: An LCID value indicating the language of the audio stream. Is zero if no language is present.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.LanguageExtension
member.summary: A enumeration that will be filled in if any information is available on the disc.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.fHasMultichannelInfo
member.summary: Indicates whether multichannel attributes are present. If TRUE, it means there is additional mixing information available, such as for SurroundSound. Call to retrieve the multichannel information.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.dwFrequency
member.summary: The frequency in hertz (48k, 96k) of the audio stream.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.bQuantization
member.summary: The resolution of the audio stream (16, 20, 24 bits, or other) Zero indicates the resolution is unknown.

member.name: DVD_AudioAttributes.bNumberOfChannels
member.summary: The number of channels. For example, 5.1 Dolby AC-3 has six channels.
